resources.string:
You don't have the permission to write to the WorkingDirectory or it doesn't exist.
 
 To save the backup of your pictures and store some temporary files, this application uses a directory at the root of the volumes carrying the pictures you want to process.
 By default it is named 'ThumbAdder' (this can be changed in the settings).
 For this to work, the directory has to exist and it must be permitted to read & write. This can be achieved only if you give the application the permission. The button below will help you to do this easily.
 
 Once you click the button some screens will appear and ask you to give access. All you have to do is confirm every step.
 1. You are asked to confirm the directory name and the location where it is created (keep default value)
 2. You give permanent read & write access to the working directory.
 
 
 You only have to confirm every screen.
 The required values are already set for you.
 
 Once permissions are set you are redirected to the main screen, and you can start again.
Add thumbnails to pictures from the selected source folders
List of source folders to process
No folder selected. Go to Settings to select.

\'All files access\' permissions is not granted on your device. You can still use this app normally but please understand that time and date of your files will be set to current time. This does not affect the time/date stored in the EXIF tags of your pictures. You may give permission in settings.

Permission to access storage is necessary to keep timestamps of files.\n If you deny permission, processing will be done without keeping timestamps.\n After permission is given, you need to restart processing.
Permission to access storage is necessary.
\u00A0Permission not given, continuing without keeping timestamps.
Thumbnail present but some fields are missing. → Updating thumbnail…
Pixymeta-android library not available in this build. Select another library in settings.
\u00A0Overwriting picture in destination dir not allowed (see settings). Destination file exists. Skipping.
\u00A0Cannot move picture to backup. File exists. Skipping.
\u00A0Not granted. Please add the folder again in Settings.
Could not copy file timestamps & attributes: %1$s
Could not store file timestamps & attributes: %1$s
Your device does not support all files access

This variant of the application doesn't permit to give 'All Files Access' permission. 

A variant with this feature is available on %1$s. 

Tip: For the installation to succeed you must first uninstall this variant of %2$s.

This directory contains the backup of the source pictures and also some temporary files created during process. It is located at the root of each volume (phone, sdcard…).\nFor example with the default value, files would be placed into <SDCARD>/ThumbAdder/DCIM.bak or <PHONE_STORAGE>/ThumbAdder/DCIM.bak
Gives access to all files on your device. This permits to keep the timestamps of the processed files. The timestamps of your pictures stored in EXIF are not altered whichever value this option has.
Rotate thumbnails to correspond to the picture. Most apps need the thumbnail to be rotated (eg. Win10 photo import)
If picture already has a thumbnail, skip processing
Fix missing tags in pictures with thumbnail
If picture has thumbnail but some mandatory tags are missing, process the picture. This replaces the current thumbnail even though you chose to skip files having thumbnails.
Backup is placed in the working directory. If a file with same name exists, it is not overwritten
Add thumbnail to the picture of the source folder
Add thumbnail to a copy of the source picture in the working directory (in \'<Volume>/ThumbAdder/<orig_dir>.new\')
Override file having same name in the working directory (this doesn\'t affect backups, which are never overwritten)
If \'%1$s\' is \'off\', copy the timestamp of the source picture to its copy in the backup directory.\nIf \'%1$s\' is \'on\', the timestamp of the backup is always kept.
Write tmp images to cache dir
Write temporary images created during processing to the cache directory of the application
Write temporary images created during processing to the working directory
Cannot disable option \'%1$s\' when using Android-Exif-Extended. Turning it back on.
Skip in case of libexif error
Skip picture if libexif reports an error

It is possible to specify a subfolder that should be excluded from processing. This value will prefix the volume id in order to form an excluded dir named \'<prefix><volId>\'. For example \'copy_of_XXXX-XXXX\'.\nThe volume id of the volume (typically an sdcard) can be found in the list of folders to process in the form of XXXX-XXXX.
Synchronize deletions made in source folders to files in backup & working directory
Files to remove (not in source anymore):
Build thumbnail from ThumbnailProject with ffmpeg\'s swscale
The notifications display the progress of processing in the notification drawer. It automatically disappears when processing is completed.
